Charles Schwab Foundation supports financial literacy education and youth programs.

Chick-fil-A is founded on conservative Christian principles and has funded organizations (WinShape Foundation) that oppose abortion. No direct corporate statement on abortion, but owner Dan Cathy has supported the National Christian Foundation which opposes abortion rights.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A_and_LGBTQ_people

WinShape Foundation (Chick-fil-A's charity) donated over $5M to anti-LGBTQ groups including Family Research Council (SPLC-designated hate group), Exodus International (conversion therapy), Marriage and Family Foundation, and Fellowship of Christian Athletes (FCA).
CEO Dan Cathy publicly opposed same-sex marriage in 2012: 'guilty as charged' when asked about opposing gay marriage; tweeted opposition to SCOTUS DOMA ruling.
2017: donated to Salvation Army, which has anti-LGBTQ positions. 2019: stopped funding FCA and Salvation Army after pressure.
As of 2021, owner Dan Cathy still associated with National Christian Foundation, described as 'spearheading the derailment of the Equality Act'.
Company operates on 'biblical definition of family'; closed Sundays reflecting strong Christian identity.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A
Chick-fil-A explicitly operates on 'biblical principles'; all locations closed Sundays, Thanksgiving, and Christmas per religious commitment.
Founder S. Truett Cathy was a devout Southern Baptist; religious values are core to corporate identity.
Dan Cathy has advocated for religious business owners' right to operate according to their faith values in the context of same-sex marriage controversy.

Chick-fil-A offers scholarships for employees ($17M+ annually through Leadership Scholarship program), above-average wages for fast food industry, and has high employee satisfaction ratings compared to industry peers.

Chick-fil-A has raised starting wages above federal minimum wage in many markets, with average starting pay reportedly above $15/hr in many locations, though no specific advocacy on minimum wage policy.
Private company; no public corporate tax position found.

As the largest US chicken sandwich chain, Chick-fil-A sources chicken from large-scale factory farms. No notable animal welfare commitments beyond basic industry standards. Chicken sandwiches require high-volume industrial poultry operations.

Chick-fil-A and WinShape Foundation provide significant education support: Leadership Scholarship program ($17M+/year), Berry College scholarships. Chick-fil-A Foundation also supports education programs.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chick-fil-A

Chipotle maintains LGBTQ non-discrimination policies, has LGBTQ employee resource groups, and participates in Pride month activities. Not a particularly prominent public advocate but maintains supportive internal policies.

Cultivate Foundation supports diverse farmers and communities; Chipotle made public statements and commitments after George Floyd's killing in 2020; has published racial equity goals and diversity reporting.
https://chipotle.com/sustainability

Chipotle relies significantly on immigrant labor; Cultivate Foundation supports sustainable farming communities including many immigrant farmers; company has been explicit about welcoming immigrant workers.

Chipotle has significantly raised wages above industry average and federal minimum wage; provides paid sick leave, parental leave, and debt-free college tuition for employees; CEO Brian Niccol advocated for higher wages publicly.
In 2022, Chipotle raised average hourly wages to $15 and set goal of $15-18/hr; starting wages well above minimum.
Chipotle has proactively raised minimum wages significantly above federal minimum and CEO has publicly supported higher minimum wage policies. Chipotle raised average wages to $15/hr as of 2022.
Chipotle has science-based emissions reduction targets, sustainability reporting, and 'Food with Integrity' environmental sourcing standards. Committed to reducing Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions.
https://www.chipotle.com/sustainability
Chipotle has commitments to clean energy, waste reduction, and sustainable packaging as part of its environmental strategy.
Chipotle's 'Food with Integrity' program favors strict environmental standards for suppliers; has pushed for sustainable agriculture practices and responsible sourcing.

Chipotle's 'Food with Integrity' program includes commitments to: no gestation crates for pigs, no cages for egg-laying hens, antibiotic-free standards, pasture-raised requirements, and higher animal welfare standards than industry norm.
https://www.chipotle.com/sustainability
Chipotle has been recognized by Humane Society as a leader in corporate animal welfare.

In 2014, after open-carry gun advocates demonstrated at Chipotle locations with AR-15 rifles, Chipotle asked customers to not bring firearms into restaurants. Company said it was 'uncomfortable' with firearms in restaurants.
Chipotle issued public statements after George Floyd's killing and made commitments to racial equity, though not prominently active on police reform specifically.
Cultivate Foundation provides educational grants; Chipotle offers tuition assistance for employees through Debt-Free Degree program (partnership with Guild Education); funding for culinary education.
Chipotle's Debt-Free Degree program offers employees tuition assistance for earning degrees with no student debt, which directly addresses student debt issue for their workforce.
